dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TwO MEN in their early twenties, JIMMY PATTERSON and TONY BUTLER, walk down a sidewalk in the Meat Packing District Funky hole-in-the-wall bars butt up against graffiti cove steel shutters protecting closed storefronts. There are f other people on the streets at this hour: Hipsters headin out to begin their night, while the homeless hunker down. Late night delivery trucks rumble down the street. Both Jimmy and Tony are dressed down in the latest hip gr wear. There's a lot of pent-up energy crackling around th guys, especially Tony, who's twitching like roach caught a trap.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Jimmy, I'm jonesin' hard. We've gotta make a stop.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Wait on it. We're already late.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, I need a taste now Tony's serious.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Okay, fine. But we make it quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and a SMALL GROUP OF PEOPLE, of varying ages and ethnicities mill around, smoking cigarettes. They are all waiting for an unmarked, but heavily secured door to open Tony is still twitching.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Man, what's the hold-up tonight?

dialogues.speaker: WAITING MAN
dialogues.text: Always like this on Fridays. Everyone waits till the last minute. The door opens and Tony steps out. The Waiting Man hurrie pushes past him into the building.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You ready?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 2.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I'm set.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Let's go. As Tony and Jimmy walk away from the building, Tony reach inside his jacket. Jimmy grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You're not gonna do it here?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You watch me.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Not cool. He scans the street, sees an alley, shielded from the streetlights.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Over there, c'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony hurries into the shadows with Jimmy a few steps behi They side-step the usual assortment of overflowing garbag cans. A few scavenging rats scurry away from their interrupted meals.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Dude, shouldn't be this bad. You're waiting too long between hook-ups.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Now you're the expert? I've been doing this longer than you.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What can I say? I'm a natural. Tony snorts derisively as he reaches inside his jacket to pull out something wrapped in PLAIN BROWN PAPER. He tears open the paper. Inside is not drugs, but a CLEAR, HOSPITA STYLE BAG FILLED WITH A RED, VISCOUS LIQUID. It looks suspiciously like BLOOD. Tony opens his mouth to reveal TWO SHARP, OVERLY LONG CAN TEETH. He BITES INTO THE BAG and a BLISSFUL LOOK spreads across his face as he GREEDILY GULPS down the blood. Seeing Tony's obvious, almost sexual satisfaction, Jimmy can't resist. He pulls out a similar bag of blood. But just as he's about to bite into his, Tony GAGS.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 3.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (jokes) What'd your mamma say about gulping your food? But Tony isn't laughing. He begins to CHOKE, then RETCHES UP RED FLUID.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tony, take it easy! What's wrong with you? As Jimmy looks on in horror, Tony begins to VIOLENTLY CONVULSE. He FALLS FACE FIRST to the ground, his body FLA WILDLY. Jimmy grabs Tony, rolls him over onto his back. Tony's face is a mask of shock and fear. A SMALL CRIMSON TRICKLE OF BLOOD runs down his chin. Tony blinks rapidly as his EYES TURN RED, filling with blood. Then, with a final, PINKISH, FROTHY COUGH, it's over. Tony's hand, still clutching the plastic bag, falls to his side. His red eye now stare sightlessly at the black night sky above. Jimmy staggers back...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (completely freaked) Tony... Oh, man, oh man... He looks down at the bag of blood he's still holding in h hand. Then, looks back toward the building from where he and Tony just came. From this distance, we can now see a brightly lit sign on the side of the building. It reads: CANAL STREET BLOOD BANK. Jimmy drops his untouched bag of blood. It falls onto the ground next to Tony's lifeless body as Jimmy turns and ru first awkwardly, than faster, faster, down the alley, awa from his dead friend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number UNIFORMED COPS mill around, putting up crime sce tape, comparing notes. A CRIME SCENE TECH snaps a few fin photos of the dead vampire, before covering it with a tar A sea of HUMAN GAWKERS, straining their necks for a glimp of gore from behind the tape, suddenly part for ALEXANDRA CANTARA, a Classically beautiful young woman in her mid- twenties. Although in civilian dress, she carries herself with a definite air of authority. Alex quickly makes her way to the front of the gathered c Flashing her badge, she fluidly ducks beneath the gaudy y police tape and is met by DETECTIVE DARNELL HARVEY.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 4. Mid-thirties, tall, with a solid, muscular build. A caree cop you'd want at your back in a dark alley at night.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Morning, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Darnell. What've we got?

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Dead Vampire. Alex follows Darnell to a tarp-covered body. They both pu on LATEX GLOVES. Alex pulls the tarp back to reveal Tony, still lying face up in what is now a pool of cold, congea blood. She scans the body.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Poor kid.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: He wasn't staked. No signs of any struggle. Just lots of regurgitated blood.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Like the Vampire we found last week.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: That's what I was thinking too.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Damn. (beat) You smell anything?

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Just death. Alex notices the empty blood bag clutched in Tony's hand.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The Canal Street Blood Bank is right around the corner. Darnell holds up an ID card.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Yeah, this was in his wallet. Name was Tony Butler. Registered with the city for weekly withdrawals. Alex picks up the still full bag of blood laying beside T  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: One bag per customer which means another Vampire was here. Let's get this blood tested. Darnell takes the bag and puts it in an evidence envelope

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: And I'll run the bag's serial number against the blood bank's records. See if I get a name. You think this other Vamp is our killer?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Vampires don't kill each other like this. And why would he take off and leave a full bag of blood behind? Especially one we can trace. Alex looks at Tony's hand clutching the empty bag.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Unless he was afraid of it...

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: You think something in the blood killed this guy? A dark, concerned expression washes over Alex's face.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The City's blood supply has always been safe. But if someone's found a way to tamper with it...

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: The Vampires will stop going to the blood banks. They'll have to find other sources for their fix.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Human sources. The Vampires will start hunting again. The Camera pans up and out of the alley, and we catch a glimpse of Alex's city, New York City...

dialogues.speaker: END OF TEASER
dialogues.text: NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large open room, filled with about a dozen or so desks all groaning under stacks of paperwork. File cabinets lin the walls. Dry erase boards list active cases. It's a typically busy day and the bureau is filled with t usual gathering of UNIFORMED COPS, PLAIN CLOTHES DETECTIV and A MOTLEY CREW OF SUSPECTS. But as the camera pans thr the room, we see there is something very different about few of the civilians: A MAN, dressed in a business suit, answering a detective' questions, has YELLOW EYES WITH OVAL CAT-LIKE PUPILS. (A Shapeshifter ) A BEAUTIFUL WOMAN gives a tearful statement to another detective. She absentmindedly pushes back her long blonde hair to reveal AN EAR WITH A POINTED TIP (A Fairy). A STOCKY AND OVERLY HAIRY MAN in handcuffs, complains ang as he's led to a holding cell. (A Troll) The Camera finds Alex and Darnell as they enter and cross paths with DETECTIVE STERN, a career cop so horribly obno he should be in parking enforcement.

dialogues.speaker: STERN
dialogues.text: Hey, Cantara, heard another bloodsucker bit the dust.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'll be sure to extend your sympathies to his family.

dialogues.speaker: STERN
dialogues.text: Don't get all snotty. Just cause I've got a real job and you're stuck chasing night crawlers

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: A crime is a crime, Stern. Everyone's equal under the law.

dialogues.speaker: STERN
dialogues.text: I remember a time when you didn't give a rat's ass about non-Human rights, Darnell.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Things change.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Guess you should know. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 7.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm just surprised she talked you into joining the SCD. Didn't the K- 9 Unit have an open spot? Darnell moves toward Stern like he's going to clock him o but Alex quickly steps between the two men.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Darnell) Go pull the paperwork on the first dead vampire. As Darnell moves off, Alex gives Stern a filthy look that sends him on his way too. Alex continues on through the room, but this exchange has escaped the attention of CHIEF ALBERT KINCAID, a been the seen that, cop in his late forties. Dealing more with politicians than criminals now, his waistline has softene his fixity of purpose has not. He intercepts Alex and they continue walking together

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: You want me to talk to Stern?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don't waste the oxygen. (beat) I need you to shut down the Canal Street Blood Bank. I've got a Vampire who died after ingesting blood from there.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: Closing the bank is going to make people very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, it's making me nervous too. (lowering her voice) The Vampire today looked a lot like the one we found last week.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: And you think there's something in the city's blood supply?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It's possible.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: All right. I'll make the call. But this is going to bring a lot of heat down on us. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 8.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just rumors of tainted blood will start a panic. It's hard enough to get Humans and Vampires to trust each other in the best of times.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: Alex, I've known you since you were sixteen and I've never heard you say anything but 'I can handle it'.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And I always do.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: But you don't have to do it all by yourself. Why can't you admit sometimes you need help?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: From some bigoted jar-head like Stern? No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I don't think Stern's volunteering. In fact, no one is. You need another cop on your squad, Alex. Have you thought any more about Detective Fletcher?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The guy from Phoenix?

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: He's a first rate cop and willing to transfer to New York just to work with you on the SCD.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: Ask him yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid opens the door to his office and strides in. Alex follows to find CAMPBELL FLETCHER waiting. Campbell is a very handsome man in his late twenties with athletic build and the cocky stance of someone very sure himself and his abilities.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: Detective Campbell Fletcher meet Detective Alexandra Cantara, head of the Supernatural Crimes Division. As Kincaid takes a seat behind his desk, Campbell extends hand to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (turning on the charm) I've heard a lot about you, Detective. He gives Alex a smile, it's a charming smile, but Alex is really not in the mood to be charmed. So, she ignores him

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: When I set up this squad you promised no interference.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: I said minimal interference.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hiring people behind my back is major Major interference. Campbell gives a little wave to get their attention.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Hello? I'm sitting right here.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Detective Fletcher, do you have any idea what you're signing up for?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact I do. Before I joined the force in Phoenix, I got my Master's degree in preternatural sociology. I've done extensive studies in non-Human criminology...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And how many non-Humans did you actually encounter out there in sunny Arizona?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Not many, but that's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I'm sensing a lot of hostility.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 10.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Wrong, Detective. What you're sensing is skepticism. I don't meet many cops so willing to volunteer for "Spook Squad" duty.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Obviously you volunteered.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: He's got a point. Alex can't believe Kincaid has blindsided her like this. They lock eyes. Alex realizes this is a fight she won't win.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Campbell) Fine, but this is my game. You play by my rules.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Got it. Campbell exits. As Alex also leaves, Kincaid stops her.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: You can't run this show all by yourself, Alex. I'm ordering you to give him a chance.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: A chance to get himself killed? She slams the door behind her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Campbell enter to find DOCTOR RICHARD HUNTER pul on a latex glove. He stands in front of an examination ta on which Tony's naked body lays. An ARRAY of SURGICAL IMPLEMENTS, some familiar some not, rest on a nearby tray

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey Doc.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Alex. I thought Darnell was coming down?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why should he have all the fun? This is Detective Fletcher. He's going to be working with us on this case. Fletcher, this is Doctor Hunter, best coroner in the city.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 11. Hunter nods hello, but Campbell only has eyes for Tony's corpse. In death, Tony's mouth hangs slightly open and th tips of his fangs glint in the overhead light. Hunter reaches down and pulls Tony's lips back to reveal even more fang.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: I took a dental mold to confirm his I.D. Bite imprint matches Tony Butler's registration records. Hunter closes Tony's mouth again and snaps on a second gl

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ever attended a Vampire autopsy before, Detective Fletcher?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (not worried) First time for everything. Hunter shoots Alexandra a look as he picks up a very shar SCALPEL.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don't worry, doc. Fletcher here has a masters degree in preternatural anthropology. Hunter shrugs and brings the scalpel to Tony's chest. He presses down to make the first cut and... Suddenly, Tony's body CONVULSES and a THICK STREAM OF BLA GOO ERUPTS from the incision, bubbling up like a mini-gey before falling back onto his chest with a squishy SPLAT. Campbell turns green, in fact, a number of different gree each shade more and more impressively sickly, but he hold his ground. Dr. Hunter looks at him knowingly,

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: The first cut's the deepest. Just a little Coroner humor and Alex brings her hand to h mouth to keep from laughing at Campbell's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It's bad form to puke on the corpse. Campbell swallows a few times.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: What is that stuff? Hunter takes a long cotton swab of the equipment tray and dips the end into the black goo.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 12.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It's the virus that turns Humans into Vampires.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (back on solid ground) Once introduced, the virus completely overwhelms the Human immune system, re-creating the host in its own image, until, viola, you're a Vampire. Hunter smears a small glass slide with the swab and moves a nearby microscope. Placing the slide on the stage, he peers through the eyepiece.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: A very painful process.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: And a purposeful one. A Vampire has to choose to infect the Human and there's no guarantee the Human will even survive the transformation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vampire Virus in the goo resembles Human blood cells but the platelets are black with a slightly different geometry. We see a BACTERIUM smother one of the healthy Vampire blood cells, destroying it.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: I found the same blood-borne infection in the Vampire you brought in last week. Some kind of bacterial toxin that suffocates healthy Vampire hemoglobin. Alex takes a look under the microscope.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was also present in the empty bag you found, but in a dormant state. It doesn't seem to attack Human hemoglobin, just Vampire.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And our first victim was found in his apartment with a half-empty cup of blood next to him.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Could it have gotten into the blood supply by accident?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 13.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: All the blood distributed by the blood banks is cloned from genetically altered cells resistant to toxemia. This had to be introduced later.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So it was deliberate.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: I'm sending samples to the National Preternatural Sciences Lab in D.C. for further testing.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Doc...

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Alex, you don't have to tell me you need the results yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, Kincaid, Darnell and Campbell sit around a conferen table. Case files and papers are strewn amongst styrofoam coffee cups and soda cans.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Two victims dead after drinking contaminated blood from the city's blood supply.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Victim number one, John Knox. Made a withdrawal from the East 70th Street Blood Bank the night he died. Victim number two, Tony Butler. Got his blood from the Canal Street Bank

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Anything to connect them?

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Just that they were Vampires. Tony was an unemployed "actor" who arrived in New York a few weeks ago. Knox was an investment strategist who lived on the Upper East Side. I talked to Knox's neighbors and co-workers. Guy didn't socialize much, rarely strayed south of the Plaza Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What about the full bag of blood we found next to Tony?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 14.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Pulled a usable print and checked it against the registry. Darnell refers to a piece of paper in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Withdrawn by one Jimmy Patterson same time Tony was there. But it tested clean. No toxin.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: He didn't stick around, try to help a fellow Vampire?

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: He probably just freaked. Jimmy's a minor league punk recently turned Vamp. Petty criminal with a couple of outstanding warrants.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: A lot of Vampires still don't trust the police.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: I got an APB out on him.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: Tell 'em to keep a low profile. I want to keep a lid on this as long possible.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: If there's no connection between our victims, the poisonings were random. Done by someone who wasn't too particular about their target.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: We got a lot of hate groups out there. Start digging, see who could pull something like this off.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: I'm on it. Darnell gathers up his files and heads out. Kincaid's CEL PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: (into phone) Kincaid. (listens) Right. He hangs up and looks at Alex.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 15.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Campbell exit their car and find themselves in t middle of a chaotic HUMAN'S FIRST RALLY. Hundreds of peop surround City Hall. Some carry signs: "NON-HUMANS = NON-

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE"
dialogues.text: CIVIL RIGHTS ACT NOW!!". Police barricades have establish a perimeter to keep the Human Protesters away from a voca and growing number of non-Human counter-protesters. AS slogans are chanted and slurs thrown back and forth, ange on both sides builds, threatening to boil over at any mom

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Humans First is a New York-based group...

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: ...O0f racists who believe all non- Humans should be exterminated. As Alex looks approvingly at Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You have done your homework As Alex and Campbell wade through the crowd, they're approached by CHASE DESMOND, a stunning woman in her late twenties, a sexy, professional, dresser who knows how to what she wants. A PRESS BADGE hangs around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Hey Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Detective Campbell Fletcher this is Chase Desmond, a reporter for the Times. Campbell smiles warmly at this alluring woman.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: You cover a lot of these protests?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Unfortunately they're news. A commotion in the crowd draws Chase's attention.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll catch you later. As Chase disappears into the crowd, Alex catches sight of two men making their way toward her.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 16.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Wonderful. JACK KEMP, a charismatic, Donald Trump-like businessman i his 50s approaches. He is trailed by MARK DALI, 30s, a sm corporate type with a permanent smirk on his handsome, bu cold face. KEMP. Alex, darling, how are you? It's been far too long...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Not long enough, Jack. (to Campbell) This is Jack Kemp, head of the Humans First movement and Mark Dali, his lap dog. Dali bristles.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: This is a legitimate gathering, Detective Cantara. We're protected by the First Amendment.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And non-Humans are protected by the 28th Amendment.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: The Non-Humans Civil Rights Act should never have been passed. And we'll do everything in our power to repeal it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Not going to happen today, Dali. (to Kemp) What's all this about, Jack? KEMP. The Human community is very concerned about the two Vampires recently killed. Concerned the Vampires will use them as an excuse to return to their old ways.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The second Vampire died less than twelve hours ago. No one has had time to get very concerned. Unless Humans First somehow anticipated it happening?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 17.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: How dare you! Mr. Kemp is a highly respected community leader... KEMP. It's alright, Mark, I'm sure Alex didn't mean anything. She's always been very passionate about her causes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You're using those dead Vampires to spread fear and paranoia. KEMP. If the NYPD is going to continue putting the rights of "Monsters" ahead of Humans, it's up to people like me to ensure the Human majority has a voice.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Even if that voice calls for the slaughter of all non-Humans? KEMP. I didn't get your name, Detective?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Fletcher, Campbell Fletcher. KEMP. A word of advice, Detective Fletcher. A battle is coming, choose your side very carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell drives, Alex, lost in thought, in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: What's the story with you and Kemp?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He was friends with my parents.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: But your mother and father were on the front lines of the Non-Human Civil Rights Movement?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And Kemp's one of the planet's biggest bigots? The irony isn't lost on me.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 18.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Your parents' study on Non-Human Integration was one of the primary sources for my Master's thesis. (beat) I'm sorry about what happened to them.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It was a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: And the police never found their killers? That must be hard. Campbell's compassion prompts Alex to make an unexpected admission.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was... It still is. Alex looks at Campbell's profile for a long moment. Campb turns to see the carefully guarded pain in Alex's eyes. There's a spark of a connection, but Alex breaks it...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pull over up here. There's someone I need to talk to. As Campbell pulls the car to the curb

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Need some back-up?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Good night, Fletcher. Alex exits the car in front of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretching down the block is a red velvet rope holding in check a long line of HOPEFUL ENTRANTS. A CROWD OF YOUNG, CLUBBY TYPES are ignoring the queue, posing for the unimpressed BOUNCER who stands in the doorway. Alex moves confidently toward the club's entrance. She bypasses the line and walks right up to the door. The Bou doesn't speak, but to the chagrin of the posers, he moves aside to let her pass. As she enters, we see a BRASS PLAQ on the door. It reads: CLUB CARNAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of leaving, Campbell watches Alex in his rear vie mirror until he sees Alex go inside the club. Then he pul the car over and parks.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The d√©cor of the main room is minimalist hipster cool. Se shades of cobalt and purple dominate. Scandinavian design light fixtures cast a warm glow on the patrons. Low slung modern couches are packed with drinkers. Another, larger room has a DJ booth and dance floor filled with dancers. Alex moves purposefully through the crowd to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: Alex sits down on a stool and almost immediately a very d Belvedere vodka martini with two olives is placed before by the beautiful, young, female BARTENDER. Alex acknowledges it with a smile. As she raises her drin to take a sip, a man suddenly appears behind her, whisper in her ear...

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: Hello, Sasha

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (without turning) Hello, Christien. We get our first look at CHRISTIEN as he sits down on the stool next to Alex. He looks so innately dangerous he mus be non-Human, but so devastating attractive, you don't ca A walking advertisement for the seductive pleasures of vampirism,

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: You look lovely as always.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'm here on business.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: That doesn't make your company any less of a pleasure. Christien reaches out to take Alex's hand. He kisses it with a delicacy that makes Alex unintentionally shiver.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come to my office. It's quieter. Christen sweeps to his feet and Alex takes a final slug o her drink (for courage?), before following him.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Campbell enters and takes in the scene, looking for Alex. As he makes his way to the bar, the camera pans over to f Jimmy (the Vampire from the Teaser).  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 20. Jimmy prowls the room, looking hungry, a little dangerous He catches the eye of WENDY, a smokin' hot club chick abo his age. Jimmy smiles, he's found his hook-up for the nig

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: Campbell makes his way to the bar and grabs a seat.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: What's your poison?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Beer.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: I've never seen you here before.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: You remember all your customers?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Just the cute ones.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I'm new in town.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Yum, fresh meat. The Bartender places the beer in front of Campbell and sm while EXTENDING TWO VERY SHARP LONG FANGS. Whoa! That was unexpected. Campbell looks around and now sees interspers with the painted-up human clubbers are Vampires. Ditching his new friend with a somewhat nervous smile, Campbell moves away from the bar and continues his search for Alex.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Christien and Alex enter a room, filled with a mix of bot modern and antique furniture. Its style is both beautiful and timeless, much like Christien. Alex sits on the sumptuous couch as Christien moves to hi personal bar. He pours himself a glass of red wine (or ma it's blood) from a crystal decanter. As he mixes Alex ano martini...

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: Olives, right?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You know me too well.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: I would say, not nearly well enough.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 21. Christien brings Alex her drink and sits down next to her Anxious to change the subject...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I assume you've heard about the tainted blood?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: News travels fast in the Vampire community.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That's what I'm afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: The police are worried Vampires will stop going to the banks and start attacking Humans.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Pretty much.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: Well, I'm worried that someone is using the blood banks to launch unprovoked attacks against my people.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We're going to find out who's responsible.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: Forgive me if I find it hard to believe the police are giving this top priority.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'm giving it top priority. But I need your help. As leader of the Vampire community in New York, you have the power to keep this contained. We've already shut down two banks and we're running tests at the others. Tell your people not to hunt.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: They're scared, they may not listen.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh, please. There isn't a Vampire in this City that would dare disobey you.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: And in return for my help?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 22.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Preventing an all out war between Humans and Vampires isn't enough? (beat) Fine. What do you want? Christien just sits, staring at Alex. She wonders what he thinking. She's sure she wouldn't like it. Well, not sure but pretty sure.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: I'll have to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, don't take too long. Alex stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Christien, until we're sure about the blood... Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: I don't take blood from the banks.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, I suppose you don't have problems finding consensual donors. Particularly of the female persuasion.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: Jealous, Sasha?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Not my scene.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: There are fringe benefits. Alex is sure there are. But their conversation is interru when the Bartender runs into the room.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Christien, you better come. There's a fight.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: (stunned) A fight? Here?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: This I have to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Christien arrive to find shocked club patrons watching as Campbell and one of Christien's BODYGUARDS  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 23. struggle. Or rather Campbell is struggling, the Bodyguard is on top of Campbell, PUMMELING him. Alex's GUN is immediately out, cocked and hovering inches from the Bodyguard's ear

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Get off him. The Bodyguard looks toward Christien for guidance. Almost too fast for the Human eye to see, Christien GRABS the Bodyguard and YANKS him way from Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Christien) Thanks. Christien casually TOSSES the Bodyguard aside like an emp candy wrapper.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: Good help is so hard to find.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. Campbell bristles at Alex's words and tone.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I thought you might need help.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: If I need help, I'll ask for it.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I doubt that.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I won't tolerate this macho-defender crap from you, Fletcher!

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: And I won't tolerate being treated like some wet-behind-the-ears rookie.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Then stop acting like one. They suddenly fall silent as they realize Christien is intently watching their bickering as someone would follow tennis match.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: No please, Sasha, don't stop on my account. This is most entertaining.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 24.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Why is it that every Vampire runs a nightclub? Don't you think it's a little clich√©?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: Not many establishments remain open all night. Can you see me behind the counter at your local Seven- Eleven? Campbell's not done with Christien, but Alex cuts him off

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Thank you for your time, Christien. We don't see him move, but suddenly Christien stands in f of Alex. Looking deep into her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: You are welcome here anytime, Sasha He eyes a steaming Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But, perhaps you should find a playmate with better manners. Alex quickly ushers Campbell across the room, practically pushing him out an emergency exit door...

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Head of Humans First, leader of the Vampire Community, you keep some pretty funky company, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Are you purposely trying to get yourself killed?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, I could tell by the way you got the crap beaten out of you.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Who do you think you are?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Back off.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Why? Tell me why and I will.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 25.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (beyond frustrated) Because people who do this job die. And I don't want to be responsible for that!

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Who died? Alex takes a deep breath. She can't believe she's even getting into this. But... there's something about the way Campbell is looking at her. Something that suddenly makes her want him to understand.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Mike Wells. We went to the Academy together. We were close. (smiling sadly) He joined the SCD because he believed in what I was trying to do. He joined because he believed in me.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We found out someone in the Fairy Court was trafficking illegal weapons. Mike went to meet an informant. Rangers found him two days later. Dead, entombed in a tree in Central Park.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: A tree?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The Fairies wanted to send a message.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: It's not your fault. He was a cop. He knew the score.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That doesn't make it any easier. For just a moment, there's something in the open, unguard way she's looking at him that threatens to take Campbell' breath away. But then, it's over, leaving Campbell to won if it even happened.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I won't let it happen again.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Wendy, the beautiful girl we saw him with earli stand in a dark corner of a parking lot down the street f Club Carnage. They're making out against a parked car After a few passionate kisses, Jimmy pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You know what I want... Wendy pulls her hair back to expose her neck. The white skin almost gleams in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: I'm told I'm very tasty. Jimmy extends his fangs, bites into her jugular. He start to drink. Ecstasy overcomes them both, until...

dialogues.speaker: WENDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, that's enough, Jimmy. But, Jimmy can't stop. He's too hungry. He continues to greedily suck at Wendy's neck

dialogues.speaker: WENDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm serious. You're taking too much! Wendy tries to squirm away, but Jimmy is too strong. We s his EYES FILL WITH BLOOD. Off Wendy as she begins to SCREAM...

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT ONE
dialogues.text: NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 27. ACT Two

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNIFORMS survey the crime scene as Alex and Darnell check out Wendy's body with a CRIME SCENE INVESTIGATOR. Wendy's body has a DISTINCT PALE PALLOR. TWO DEEP PUNCTURE MARKS her neck are plainly visible. cSI Judging by rigor and liver temp, I'd put time of death around 4 AM. Cause of death was exsanguination. She was drunk dry.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Get an impression of the puncture wounds. Hopefully our perp's dental molds are on file. Alex and Darnell step aside as the CSI signals for a gurn to take the body away.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: It's been months since a Vampire killed a Human like this.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I just can't believe it happened so close to the Club.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Think we're looking for a hungry Vamp too scared to go to the blood banks?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: A Vampire more scared of the banks than he is of Christien? That's pretty damn scared. Something isn't right here. Darnell looks over to Campbell who's a short distance awa talking to a short man.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: How's it going with Fletcher?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: A master's degree is no substitute for experience.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: I wasn't exactly an expert in non- Humans when you recruited me.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 28.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That was different and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: I still think you should cut Campbell some slack. We can use all the help we can get right now.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I know. I'm trying. At Darnell's look.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am. (changing the subject) Make sure the CSIs get a cast of Wendy's puncture wounds. Maybe our perp's fang molds are in the system. Alex moves away.

dialogues.speaker: WITH CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Campbell interrogates a TROLL who stands next to a large garbage dumpster. A makeshift tent made of plastic bags a cardboard, and the clutter around it, indicates the Troll been camping out here for a while.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: You must've seen something.

dialogues.speaker: TROLL
dialogues.text: We don't like to get involved. This is a Human thing, a Vampire thing. Not a Troll thing.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I'm going to make this a "Troll thing" unless you start cooperating.

dialogues.speaker: TROLL
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Maybe I saw something.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: The girl and the Vampire?

dialogues.speaker: TROLL
dialogues.text: I saw them leave the club. Head off together. That's all I remember

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Think you'll remember more down at the station?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 29. After a beat, the Troll reaches into his tent and pulls o a PURSE. Campbell practically grabs it from him.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this the girl's purse? Did you steal this?

dialogues.speaker: TROLL
dialogues.text: I found it. Later. After. She didn't need it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? Alex approaches.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to the Troll) Go see Detective Harvey. Give him your Guild Name in case we need to talk to you again. The Troll stalks off, mumbling under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: We should take him in.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Trolls have a very set view of "finders-Keepers". He doesn't think he did anything wrong. Campbell begins to search the purse's contents.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This happened just a few hours after we left the Club.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Your Vampire friend seemed kind of pissed. Could he be involved?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Christien? Not a chance. (beat) And we're not friends.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Then what are you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: None of your business.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Why does he call you 'Sasha'?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 30.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDRA
dialogues.text: It's a nickname for Alexandra.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Can I call you Sasha?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDRA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: What makes Christien so special?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Just that he's the oldest, most powerful Vampire in New York.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Good point. Campbell pulls an ID out of the purse.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our dead girl is one Wendy Williams. I've got her address.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Take Darnell and check out her apartment. Alex's cell phone rings. She opens it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Detective Cantara.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is Bill White from the Canal Street Blood Bank. I've been going through my records like you asked. I think I found something...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex walks with BILL SMITH, a young, ernest, overworked c servant-type who also happens to be a Vampire

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I was going over the delivery invoices from last week and I came across some discrepancies. He opens the door to...  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTY GIBSON, a beefy Teamster with an attitude sits impatiently. He doesn't want to be there.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Detective Cantara, this is Marty Gibson.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What do you do here, Marty?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I'm a driver.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Marty picks up the blood bags from the processing facilities and distributes them to banks throughout the city.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I don't know why you're making such a big deal out of this. Blood is blood. The Vamps don't care where they get it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You Human, Marty?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I don't have a problem with Non-Humans if that's where you're goin'. Hell, my sister's dating a Shifty. Had him over for barbecue just last week.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How very PC of you.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We're supposed to receive our allotted supply of blood from the processing facility in Trenton every Thursday. Last week, Marty didn't make his pick-up.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What happened Marty?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I was running behind. You know what the traffic's like going through the tunnel? I wasn't going to make my day.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: So, you gave us blood meant for the Morningside Heights Bank.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I made it up on my next run. It's not like there was going to be run on the stuff. Not with everything that's been going on.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Was the blood that killed Tony Butler from that batch?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Marty) Where'd you pick-up the blood you delivered here?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: The plant out in Queens.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Bill) What other banks does that facility supply to? Bill takes a clipboard from his desk. Flips through the pages...

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Morningside Heights, Times Square, East 70th Street...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The East 70th Street Bank? That's where the first victim got his blood. Both Knox and Tony's blood came from the same plant...

A typically tiny New York apartment shared by two young w Ikea, futons, more clothes than closet space. Campbell sits on a small futon couch with Wendy's roommat SHANNON KELLY, an adorable girl in her early 20s. She gazes deeply into Campbell's eyes as he desperately t to remember the questions he's supposed to be asking her

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Anyway, Ms. Kelly, we were hoping...  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 33.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Please, call me Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Shannon. That's a beautiful name.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You're sweet. Shannon puts a hand on Campbell's thigh and he breaks int sweat.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Thanks. But, um, we really need to ask you some questions about Wendy.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you rather talk about me?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Or, maybe you could tell me a little about you. Campbell moves a little closer to Shannon. He's practical panting. Darnell enters from the back bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) Quit it with the Glamour Shannon. (to Campbell) She's a Fairy. Using mind tricks to seduce you. Shannon breaks eye contact with Campbell who startles as suddenly woken from a day-dream, a very erotic daydream.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I was just messing around. As Campbell collects himself.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: You don't seem too upset about your friend.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: She wasn't my friend, just my roommate. Besides I warned her told her it was just a matter of time. Wendy was always picking up Vamps. She was starting to look like a Human pincushion.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: She let them bite her?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 34.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: She was totally into it. Said it was great buzz.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Was Wendy trying to become a Vampire?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: No, I don't think she wanted to take it that far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell and Darnell head back to their car.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Sorry about that in there. The Glamour thing. I never had a Fairy do that to me before.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: (knowingly) You liked it, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: It was... intense.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: I almost woke up married once. But you get hit enough, you can start seeing past it, keep it from affecting you so much. Darnell and Campbell get in their car

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: You think Shannon was telling the truth about Wendy being some kind of Vampire groupie?

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: It's more common than you'd think.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I can't imagine letting someone do that to me.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: You couldn't imagine getting Glamoured until a few minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: How'd did you end up involved with all this non-Human stuff?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 35.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: I don't like to talk about it. Darnell starts up the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and the FACILITY'S MANAGER, CURT SMITH, a 30-ish, sh and tie, put-upon managerial-type, tour the high-tech blo processing facility. SECURITY CAMERAS are omnipresent, as are ARMED SECURITY GUARDS. Every person they pass wears a SECURITY BADGE.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I've got two dead Vampires who drank tainted blood processed at this facility.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: We process over one thousand pints of blood a day.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And it's all cloned here on site?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Yes, we extract the key elements of human plasma from the milk of cows that have had their plasma genes replaced with human ones.

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD CLONING LAB
dialogues.text: Lab technicians dressed in medical scrubs, wearing protec goggles, masks and gloves work extracting the compounds t clone blood.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course, the cows don't live here. But, the genetically altered milk is brought here and the essential proteins extracted to grow the cloned plasma.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I assume your employees are carefully screened?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: You'd have an easier time getting a job with the CIA.

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD PROCESSING LAB
dialogues.text: More TECHNICIANS supervise the BLOOD ANALYSIS PROCESS. Th involves large amounts of blood flowing through an intric network of tubes and through the spectrometers that check the blood.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 36.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every drop of blood is purified before it's packaged.

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD PACKAGING
dialogues.text: Technicians man the BLOOD PACKAGING EQUIPMENT. Picture a high-tech version of a bottling plant, with blood flowing into individual plastic bags, which are sealed and bar co

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Each bag of blood individually sealed and bar coded.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How are requests from the blood banks processed?

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD STORAGE
dialogues.text: A large warehouse space. Armed guards stand ready. A robo arm moves along the shelves of stored blood, before stopp and removing a container of individual blood bags.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: By computer. Requests are submitted and an automated system pulls blood lots for dispatch.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: What it lacks in personality it makes up for in functiona

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And the blood lots are distributed randomly based on individual blood bank requests?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: It's what guarantees freshness.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Who's the last person to handle the blood before it leaves for the banks?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: That would be me. As the Senior Facility Manager, I supervise everything from beginning to end.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Then how did the toxin get into the blood without you knowing about it?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: I have no idea.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 37.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You can understand why that makes you rather suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: You think I'm responsible for the poisonings?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You had the opportunity. Motive, I don't know? Maybe you've got something against Vampires. Maybe Humans First put you up to it? A smile plays across Smith's lips.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I say something funny? Smith opens his mouth wide and EXTENDS HIS FANGS.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: I don't think I'm your man, Detective Cantara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks up from her computer screen as Chase Desmond perches on the corner of Alex's desk

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: You've got three more dead Vampires in Brooklyn. And Blood Bank withdrawals are down almost twenty percent.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Believe me, I know.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: You think Jack Kemp's Humans First Movement is behind the poisonings?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You know I can't comment on an on- going investigation.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I've got a source who says Christien is losing control of the Vampires. They're ready to hit the streets whether he likes it or not.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You can't go public with that.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 38.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: The public has a right to know if a war is starting.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Chase, whoever is doing this is looking for publicity. Wants Humans and Vampires afraid of each other. Don't play into their hands. Chase thinks about it for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Nothing's confirmed yet. I'll sit on it until it is. (sweetly) If you promise me a scoop.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don't even think about trying to glam me. I'm so not in the mood. Chase pushes her hair back and we see the pointed ear, sh a Fairy.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Damn you're cranky. Fine, enough business. As a friend, what can I do?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Besides the Vampires, what are the other non-Humans thinking? Anything going on I don't know about?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Everyone's just mostly waiting to see how it plays out. Consensus is that Humans First is behind it and they won't stop with the Vampires.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, Darnell's been tracking the hate groups. Humans First is the only one organized enough to put something like this together. (beat) A year ago, I wouldn't have thought Kemp would try anything this extreme. But ever since he hired Dali...

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Dali's got an ego, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (surprised) You know him?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 39.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I did a piece on him right after he moved here from Boston. He came on to me big time.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Did Dali know you were a Fairy?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I don't hide it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark Dali sits behind a meticulously neat and organized d in his well-appointed office. The walls are lined with various Humans First propaganda posters. Across from him sit TWO 20-SOMETHING, THUGY FOOT SOLDIERS of Humans First RICH and JEFF.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Two more Humans were put in the hospital last night. Attacked by hungry Vamps.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: The public will soon realize how stupid they were to let blood suckers walk amongst us. That's when we'll call for the mass extermination of all non-Humans.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, we just sit here?

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. How would you boys like to have a little fun tonight?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: One of my informants has infiltrated Club Carnage. I know who the filth is that killed that poor girl the other night. This is where you can find him. Dali slides a piece of paper across his desk toward Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: We'll show him what we think of his kind.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 40. Dali smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Single, enormous, open room, loft-like with high beamed ceilings, brick walls and large steel windows opening on the rooftop beyond. At the far end of the room, a spiral staircase winds its way up to a second level. The front door opens and a weary Alex comes home to grab quick shower and change. Sleep would be nice, very nice.. About to reach for the lights, she suddenly whirls, gun o In the dim light, she makes out a figure sitting in a cha

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: God. You almost got yourself shot! Alex re-holsters her gun and turns on the light to reveal

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: That would've hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: I'm getting a lot of pressure to call for a boycott of the blood banks.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'm getting squeezed too. Kemp and Dali are turning this into a media circus. Wendy's parents are pushing the Mayor for a "Stake 'em first ask questions later" investigation into their daughter's death.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: I will find out which Vampire dared to defy me and deal with him. Personally.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, that's my job.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: There are Human matters and there are Vampire matters, Sasha. Don't confuse the two.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is that a threat?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: I hope not. For both our sakes.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 41. And with that, he's gone, leaving Alex to wonder exactly what he meant by that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell and Darnell are parked, hidden in the shadows be street lights.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: So the full bag

dialogues.speaker: PBELL
dialogues.text: of blood we found by Tony's body belongs to this Jimmy guy?

dialogues.speaker: DAR
dialogues.text: Yeah, the regis up. informants that around Tompkins some other Vamps.

dialogues.speaker: NELL
dialogues.text: tration number matched I got a tip from one of my Troll he's been hanging Square Park with

dialogues.speaker: PBELL
dialogues.text: And he hasn't made a withdrawal since the other night?

dialogues.speaker: DAR
dialogues.text: Nope. transaction in

dialogues.speaker: NELL
dialogues.text: We're monitoring every blood the city.

dialogues.speaker: PBELL
dialogues.text: He's got to be getting pretty hungry by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and TWO COMPANIONS enter the small park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell and Darnell exit their vehicle and follow.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Jimmy and his companions as they talk and pass a bottle b and forth between them. Suddenly, Jeff and Rich emerge fr the dark.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Hey blood sucker.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: No Human girls to feed on tonight?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. Piss off.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 42.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I think you do. In a flash, Rich pulls out a STAKE. Jimmy's companions ta off. Across the park, Campbell and Darnell see what's happening and break into a run.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (panicked) Look, okay, I'm sorry. I took too much but I couldn't help it. I was so hungry. You gotta believe me man, it was an accident... Jimmy's words fall on deaf ears. Jeff and Rich POUNCE on Jimmy, sending him sprawling to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: This is for Wendy. Rich DRIVES the stake through Jimmy's heart, killing him instantly. Darnell and Campbell pull guns as they run.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Police! Drop it! But he can't get a shot, it's too dark. Jeff and Rich ign him and take off running. Darnell and Campbell reach Jimm Darnell takes one look at the Vampire.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's gone. They take off again after Jeff and Rich who have a pretty good head start on our people. It doesn't look we'll be able to catch up with them, until... Mid-stride, DARNELL's body transforms as he SHAPESHIFTS I A WEREWOLF. His eyes turn YELLOW as his jaw lengthens to accommodate a set of LARGE, GNASHING, CANINE TEETH. His arms and legs bulge with growing muscular bulk and his sk sprouts heavy, coarse hair. Now, a hybrid creature of RIPPLING MUSCLE and SLASHING CL Darnell still runs on two legs, but much faster than any Human. He quickly closes the gap between himself and Jeff and Rich, leaving Campbell struggling to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell has a terrified Jeff and Rich cornered and coweri He VICIOUSLY SNARLS, reveling in his POWERFUL JAWS and TE Campbell reaches them and manages to cover the two men wi his gun, but his hands are shaky and he's only got eyes f the snarling creature that used to be Darnell...

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT TWO
dialogues.text: NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Spartan box of a room, small table, two chairs, walls b Darnell, thick file in hand, circles the seated Rich. Campbell stands in the Observation Room behind a two-way mirror. He watches Darnell, fascinated. This is the same man he saw transform into that creature last night?

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Boston P.D. sent down you and your buddy's files. Thick as a phone books. Numerous arrests for assault, inciting violence, concealed weapons... Oh, and lookie here, you did five years for manslaughter.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: Stinkin' Troll got what was comin' to him. Darnell SLAPS Rich across the back of the head with his f

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Humans First must've been psyched to recruit a bigot like you.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: We're comin' after you and all your kind, Shifty. Darnell gets in Rich's face. His eyes SHIFT-CHANGE, becom yellow. The eyes of a wolf.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: (snarling) And just how's that gonna go?

dialogues.speaker: ON CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: He takes an involuntary step back from the window.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: There's a knock at the door. Alex sticks her head inside.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Darnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell joins Alex and Campbell. He's calmed down. His eyes are back to normal.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 44.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Forensics report just came back. Jimmy's fang molds match the cast made of Wendy's puncture wounds. Jimmy was Wendy's killer.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: How did these two losers know that before we did?

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Humans First must've sent them out. Kemp knows killing Jimmy would get the Vampires riled up.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: But who gave Kemp his info? Nobody in the Vampire community would give up Jimmy to Kemp, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: He's getting him information from somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: This whole thing is starting to feel very orchestrated. The poisonings, Jimmy's murder. I feel like there's a connection we're not seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid intercepts Alex.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: I got a report of another dead Vampire in Staten Island. Did you get anything from the two guys you brought in?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Just that they're loyal foot soldiers for Humans First.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: The Mayor's Office is crawling up my ass. Did you know Christien shut down Club Carnage?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (shocked) No.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: What does it mean?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That Christien isn't confident he can control what goes on there. And that's not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell walks in to find Darnell pouring himself a cup o coffee. As Campbell grabs a cup and waits, Darnell can't help notice Campbell seems a little uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: (defensive) You expecting me to start humping your leg or something?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: No, of course, not.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: You got a problem with me now?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Darnell, no. It's cool. I just wasn't expecting it. Darnell sees that Campbell means it. It's a nice change.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry. It usually takes people a while to get used to it. (beat) ) Hell, I'm still getting used to it.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: How'd it happen?

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: About a year ago, my partner and I responded to a domestic dispute. We were attacked by a Shapeshifter and contracted the disease. He didn't survive the change. I did.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Is that how you ended up in the SCD?

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: It's funny, I was a lot like Rich once. Couldn't stand non-Humans. Thought they were all a bunch of freaks. Then boom, I'ma freak. Only I was still me, you know? Most of my old buddies didn't see it that way. Couldn't see past what I'd become. (MORE )
NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 46.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was this close to quitting the force. But Alex convinced me to stay. Use my ‚Äòunique perspective! to help people.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: She was right. You're still a good cop.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alex and Darnell review their notes, Campbell enters holding a file.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: We got the blood work back from the Preternatural Sciences Lab in D.C. It's a bacterial protein toxin, with a specific cytotoxix activity that invades healthy Vampire hemoglobin.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Well, that sure clears everything up.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: The toxin was specifically manufactured to attack a Vampire's cell structure.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sounds like some pretty heavy duty engineering.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: A DNA marker traced the toxin back to a study into Vampirism conducted by BioGen Laboratories in Boston. Darnell moves to a computer and does a Web search for Bio

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Look at this. BioGen is a subsidiary of Kemp Industries.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Doubt that's a coincidence. Can you pull up an employee list?

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: No problem. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 47.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) They're a government contractor so photos are on file too. Campbell and Alex move to stand behind Darnell.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: Names and faces scroll past. Unfamiliar, anonymous.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Stop. Back it up one. The screen backs up one ID. We see a familiar face and na

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Curt Smith. Currently manager of the blood processing facility in Queens.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I thought you said he was a Vampire?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He is. Darnell hits more keys and another screen comes up.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Smith's not in the National Non-Human Registry.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: If he didn't register, it means he's got something to hide.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Not that he's a Vampire. He was pretty open about it. (beat) Darnell, go to the blood processing facility and pick him up. Take some back-up in case he resists.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Want me to go with him?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No. You and I are going to have a little chat with Kemp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kemp paces the floor of his spacious office speaking into telephone headset.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 48. Floor to ceiling windows behind his mammoth desk reveal breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline. The doors suddenly burst open and Alex, followed by Campb strides in. KEMP. (into headset) I'll have to call you back. Alex walks up to Kemp, gets right in his face.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You lied to me. Kemp sits down behind his desk, cool and relaxed. KEMP. Why don't you calm down and tell me what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Not only are you using the recent Vampire poisonings to further your agenda, but you're behind the whole thing. KEMP. That's insane!

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: You own BioGen Labs in Boston. KEMP. I own a lot of companies.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: What do they do there? KEMP. Study the Vampire and Shapeshifter Viruses. We're trying to find an antidote.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Have you asked if they want one?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Tell me about Curt Smith. He worked at BioGen. KEMP. I employ literally thousands of people, I can't be expected to know them all by name.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 49.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'd think you'd remember this one. He's a Vampire. KEMP. Don't be ridiculous. I'd never hire a Vampire. Campbell tosses a picture of Curt Smith across the desk.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You hired this one. Kemp is clearly shocked, even horrified. KEMP. Smith's a Vampire?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: So, you do know him? KEMP. I've met him a few times. He works with Dali.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why is Dali hanging around a Vampire? KEMP. I assure you Alex, I had no idea Smith was a Vampire. (beat) That's the problem, it's too hard to tell these days. The penny drops for Alex. A big, heavy, very scary penny. Alex abruptly turns and hurries out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Looks like we're done here. Thanks. He goes after Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell catches up with Alex. They move quickly through the hallway together.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: What? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Kemp's right. It is hard to tell these days. This is all starting to make sense. (beat) Dali is from Boston, so is Smith.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 50. Campbell is right there with her

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: And those two goons we picked up. If Dali brought his people down with him, he's been planning this for a while.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Christien said something the other night. There are Human matters and Vampire matters. This has been about the Vampires all along. Just not in the way we thought.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Dali. I think he's a Vampire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curt Smith and Dali confer.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: I got a call from a friend at BioGen. The cops have been sniffing around.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: This pushes our timetable up a bit. (beat) Are we ready?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Now, that we've laid the groundwork, the rest of the poisoned blood will be distributed tonight. There'll be a thousand dead Vampires by morning.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: And thousands more looking for new leadership. Strong leadership that will return our people to their once feared position of power

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Christien still has a lot of support.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: After tonight, Christien won't be a problem. Dali opens his mouth and SLIDES OFF THE CAPS COVERING HIS CANINE TEETH AND EXTENDS A SET OF HUGE FANGS.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 51.

dialogues.speaker: DALI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have no idea how uncomfortable these are. An INTERCOM on Dali's desk buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: DALI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON INTERCOM
dialogues.text: Mr. Dali, this is security. Two police detectives are on their way up to your office. Dali quickly moves from behind his desk toward the room's back door.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: Curt, take care of them. I have an appointment I don't want to be late for. As Dali exits, Curt smiles widely, revealing his sharp fa

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: My pleasure. A beat later, Alex and Campbell enter Dali's office, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Nothing stupid, Smith. Get down on the ground. NOW! In the blink of an eye, Smith GOES FULL VAMP (fangs exten eyes blood red) and LAUNCHES himself at Alex and Campbell Campbell OPENS FIRES. The bullets STRIKE Smith, but barel slow him down.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Campbell) He's too old, bullets won't stop him. Smith POUNCES on Campbell, quickly taking Campbell to the ground. Campbell fights back, landing VICIOUS BLOWS to Smith's neck and face. A blow connects with Smith's nose, spraying Campbell with BLOOD. Alex reaches inside her jacket and pulls out A SMALL SILV CYLINDER. With a TWIST OF HER WRIST, the cylinder EXTENDS to become a HIGH-TECH STAKE. Campbell struggles with all his strength to keep Smith's fangs away from his neck. But he loses his grip and Smith fangs descend....  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 52. Smith BITES Campbell just as Alex PLUNGES her stake into Smith's back and PIERCES HIS HEART. Smith falls DEAD on t of Campbell. Alex yanks Smith's body off Campbell and drops it heavily the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (re: Alex's stake) How do I requisition one of those? Campbell holds his neck where he was bitten.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I think he nicked me. Alex moves Campbell's hand to find an UGLY GASH on Campbe neck where Smith's fangs had ripped the skin. We see Campbell's bright red blood on Alex's hand as she pulls a handkerchief out of her pocket and carefully presses it t the wound.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That's more than a nick. But he missed the jugular.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I don't think he had a chance to infect me with the virus.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, he was trying to kill you, not turn you.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I'll get tested anyway. Just to be sure. Alex helps Campbell up. He's pale, but steady on his feet

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You sure you're okay? Should we call the EMTs?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I'm fine. All in a day's work. Alex knows he's putting on a brave front for her, but she impressed anyway. She reaches out to wipe a splatter of blood from Campbell's face.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 53.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Not bad, Fletcher. A lot of people would've really freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Don't go all soft on me now, Detective. We still have work to do. Alex and Campbell move to Dali's desk and begin searching it. Campbell spots Dali's discarded teeth caps.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL, (CONT'D)
