dialogues.text: What are these? Alex takes the small pieces of white porcelain from Campb

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Caps. Dali must've used them to hide his fangs.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Why'd he leave them?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He must think he doesn't need them anymore. Doesn't need to hide. Campbell moves to Smith's body. He begins to riffle throu Smith pockets. Campbell pulls out a FEW FOLDED SHEETS OF PAPER.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Alex, look at this. Campbell shows her the papers.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Shipping orders from the Blood Processing Facility. Poisoned blood is being sent all over the city tonight.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: But why is Dali doing this? why does he want Humans and Vampires fighting each other? What does he get out of it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It's a power play. By poisoning the blood supply, Dali's convinced the Vampires they're not safe anymore. He's going to use their fear to turn them against Christien.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 54.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Dali wants to become the new leader of the Vampires?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Which means the only person standing in his way now is... Alex pulls out her cell phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Christien pick up. Pick up! Alex snaps her phone closed and hands Campbell the shippi lists.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take these lists to Kincaid. Tell him to rally every cop in the city. If we don't stop this tainted blood from getting to the blood banks, New York is going to become a war zone. Off Alex...

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT THREE
dialogues.text: NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At VARIOUS LOCATIONS around the City, a frantic and massi police operation is under way. CAMPBELL leads a TEAM OF UNIFORMED OFFICERS into a Blood Bank, where a truck is in the middle of off-loading its s of tainted blood. DARNELL, behind the wheel of an unmarked police car with lights flashing, SKIDS to a STOP in front of a BLOOD TRAN TRUCK. He leaps out of the car, badge in one hand, gun in the other. KINCAID leads a fleet of BLACK AND WHITES, LIGHTS FLASHIN AND SIRENS BLARING, as they intercept other BLOOD TRANSFE TRUCKS . Unsuspecting DRIVERS are pulled from their trucks at gun point, as OFFICERS secure their deadly payloads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex enters to find the Club dark, empty, and all too qui She draws her weapon.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Christien?! No answer. Alex cocks her gun.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Christien? Are you here? Alex's senses are on fire, she's not frightened, just foc Something moves in the deep shadows across the room. Alex sees it and trains her gun in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: DALI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it's just me. Dali emerges from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Stop right there. Dali doesn't stop. He continues to walk toward Alex.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: Or what? You'll shoot me? Do you think your bullets can kill me?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I think they'll hurt. A lot.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 56.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of a little pain. In fact, I might enjoy it. Keeping her gun trained on Dali, she reaches into her poc with her other hand and finds her stake. She extends it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How'd you enjoy your time with Humans First?

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: I laughed myself to sleep every night.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How could you pass for Human for so long? I saw you at the Rally. You were standing in broad daylight.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: I have lived many years, Alex. More even than your friend Christien. There are only a handful of us in the world and we are very, very powerful. Dali is getting entirely too close. Alex doesn't want to give up ground, but she doesn't want to have to fight thi fucker either.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What do you want? Dali circles Alex, studying her, careful to stay just out reach of her stake. Just in case.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: I've decided to get into politics. As many of your Human leaders have proven, there's no better way to consolidate power than to start a war.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I can't let you do that.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: I am a Sanguis Vestus. You can't stop me.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I don't care if you're the Queen of the Damned, this is my City. Alex suddenly draws in a SHORT STARTLED BREATH as she fee another PRESENCE in the room.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 57. The Camera finds Christien, who has appeared as if out of thin air.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: No, it's mine. The air crackles with tension, there's an energy that's a palpable.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: You had your chance to lead Christien. But you sold your people out, pandering to the Humans, subjugating yourself to their laws.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Those laws keep the peace.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: Stay out of this Alex. (to Dali) We have laws too, Dali. And you've broken them. Killed your own kind by poisoning their blood.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: Cloned blood from banks? Vampires have become nothing but pigs feeding at the Humans' trough. I will return the Vampire Community to prominence. No more blood banks. No more living in fear of Humans and their laws.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: You're talking about starting a war.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: One that's been long overdue.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: One we may not win.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: You just don't have the stomach for it. Christien just smiles. It's a smile that promises death. Alex gives everyone one more chance to be reasonable...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Christien, this is a police matter Dali, I'm placing you under arrest... She knows its stupid even as she says it, but hey, it's h job. Dali never takes his eyes off Christen.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 58.

dialogues.speaker: DALI
dialogues.text: (to Alex) Stick around, Detective. I'm going to be hungry when I'm done. And with a rush of air and sound it begins. Alex dives out of the way as Christien rushes Dali. But with staggering speed, Dali side-steps Christien and uses his momentum to HURL Christien across the Club. Christien SMASHES into a wall. But, Christien quickly recovers and LEAPS, almost flies, back to Dali, landing a SERIES OF BLOWS that staggers Dal but he doesn't fall. Christien and Dali TRADE SAVAGE BLOWS that would kill a H VICIOUS ROUND HOUSE KICKS snap necks and heads backward a they crash against each other and to the floor, only to r to their feet and continue their brutal ballet. BLOOD FLOWS from their noses, mouth, eyes, yet the feroci of their attacks do not wane until Christien finally gain the upper hand. He catches Dali's guard down for a split second and DRIVES him across the room. Christien and Dali crash into the bar, sliding across its smooth surface, shattering bottles and other assorted gla as they go. Dali is momentarily STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: IN SLOW MOTION
dialogues.text: Christien raises himself over Dali. His eyes are FILLED WITH BLOOD. He DRAWS his HAND back and over his head, rea to plunge his fist into Dali's chest and rip his heart ou

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SPEED
dialogues.text: Alex runs toward them.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Christien's focus is broken. He looks at Alex as if she's lost her mind.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: I have the right to kill any Vampire that challenges me.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: This isn't only about Vampires. Dali's crimes affected Humans too. If you kill him now, the City has no closure. Without Dali, we'll never be able to explain what happened. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 59.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we don't bring him in, how can we convince people its over? Right now, Christien doesn't care. With incredible streng he grabs Dali around the neck and lifts him straight up i the air. Dali SHRIEKS AND FLAILS WILDLY. Alex GRABS Christien's arm.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Christien, this city. Your City needs to see Dali punished under the law, everyone's law. Christien locks eyes with Alex for a long moment. Then, Christien lets out a horrible SCREAM of un-exercised RAGE he HURLS Dali across the room. Dali CRASHES into a wall and falls unconscious to the gro Christien turns to Alex, his eyes slowly draining of thei red...

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: That's two you owe me. UNIFORMED POLICE burst in the room to find Alex and a blo Christien standing silently in the middle of the dark Clu

dialogues.speaker: ON A TELEVISION
dialogues.text: Kincaid stands at a PODIUM. In front of him, A CLUSTER OF MICROPHONES and a SMALL SEA OF REPORTERS. Behind him, Jac Kemp tries to hide his discomfort to be standing shoulder shoulder with his most hated adversary, Christien. Christ loves that Kemp is miserable and, of course, he loves the camera.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: The Mayor's Office, in conjunction with the NYPD, has officially confirmed that all the contaminated blood has been accounted for and destroyed. The blood in our Blood Bank System is now 100% safe. Kincaid steps back from the microphones, as Christien ste forward.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIEN
dialogues.text: On behalf of the entire Vampire Community I would like to extend our thanks to the NYPD, especially the Supernatural Crimes Division, in dealing so quickly with a very dangerous situation. We are grateful that the rule of law has prevailed.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 60. As the cameras click and their flashes strobe, Christien gives Kincaid a hearty handshake, before stepping back. H gives Kemp a smirk as Kemp approaches the microphone. KEMP. As the public is well aware, Humans First has always been and will continue to be a law-abiding organization. The unfortunate actions of one man will in no way derail us from our stated goals. The gathered Reporters pounce...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 1
dialogues.text: Mr. Kemp, what does it mean that a Vampire was able to infiltrate Humans First so easily?

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 2
dialogues.text: Mr, Kemp, is it true you personally recruited Dali? As Kemp hems and haws, we pull back to REVEAL we're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A local cop hang out. Lots of brass and wood. Pictures of fallen officers adorn the wall behind the bar. Definitely more of a beer and shots than cocktails crowd. Alex and Chase sit at the bar. In front of them are two glasses on wine and a copy of THE NEW YORK TIMES.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON
dialogues.text: The Headline: HIGH RANKING MEMBER OF HUMAN'S FIRST REVEAL TO BE A VAMPIRE. Byline: CHASE DESMOND.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The television continues to drone on in the background, b Alex and Chase have seen all they want to see.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Did you see the look on Kemp's face? Classic.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He's going to be living this down for a long time. Alex and Chase pick up their glasses and clink them ina little toast.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 61.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: You took a big chance going to Club Carnage like that.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I had to get that scoop I promised you, right?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: It's not funny. What if Dali had killed Christien? You would've been next. Alex thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You know, it's weird. That didn't even occur to me. I just assumed Christien would win.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: He isn't invincible.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don't tell him that. (beat) I don't know what I would've done if he'd killed Dali. I'm picturing trying to get the cuffs on him...

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Harder in this situation than a couple others I can think of.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Ha, ha.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: You know Christien wants you. He didn't spare Dali for the 'sake of the city'. He did it for you. Because it was important to you. Alex stares into her glass where the red wine swirls. She notices it's almost the color of blood.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How am I supposed...? She stops mid-sentence when she sees Campbell approaching

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Hey.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 62. He sees Chase.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't want to interrupt. Chase stands as Alex lets Campbell in.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Actually I was just leaving. Nice to see you again, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Likewise. Chase grabs her coat and gives Alex a hug goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: (whispering) He's hot. For a Human. The bar patrons part appreciatively for Chase as she sail out the door. Campbell sits down and puts his drink on the bar

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Nice to have a night off.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don't get used to it, they're few and far between. (beat) You did pretty good out there, Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Just pretty good? Come on, I've got war wounds. Campbell reflexively puts a hand to his bandaged neck

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How is it?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Got the blood tests back. Still one hundred percent Human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a "Thank God" in there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Not ready to see how the other half lives?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I think I'll leave that to Darnell. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 63.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Although I suppose being a Vampire could have its moments. Campbell raises an eyebrow, but Alex isn't taking the bai There's been enough talk about Vampires tonight.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, am I in, or what? Kincaid said you have the final say. Alex picks up her glass and holds it up. Part of her is sure this is a mistake, but there's something about him..

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don't make me regret this. Campbell leans in to her space. He is only inches away. Alex can feel the warmth of his skin, feel his breath on face as he asks,

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: What's life without a few regrets?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Welcome to the squad, Campbell. With a grin, Campbell drains his glass with a single swal and Alex suspects her life suddenly just became even more complicated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS UP to a FULL MOON high above the city, Al city. CAMERA PANS OFF the FULL MOON and finds... Christien, standing on a balcony, watching the same moon high above the city, Christien's city.
